instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041 5v only
threads.message: Got a 820-01041 in that does not appear to be liquid damaged , but it was worked on before. It has 5v 0.01a on all 4 ports. Found PPBUS_G3H was shorted to ground through U7220. Replaced that and the short was gone but still have the same issue with 5v 0.01a. PPBUS is 0v and PP1V8_SLPS2R is also 0v and not shorted to ground. Wondering if I should continue on this or is this a dead CPU due to shorted U7220?

threads.title: 820-01041 5v only
threads.message:
Very likely dead CPU, because of overvoltage.
Compare exact ohm value on CPU coils with a good board...

threads.title: 820-01041 5v only
threads.message: Yea I compared values on the CPU coils with another board and they are lower than normal. CPU is dead on this one. Thanks
